# [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/18926?src=pr&el=h1) Report
> Merging [#18926](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/18926?src=pr&el=desc) into [master](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/commit/0e3c797c4c12fa04fd745e595e822886e917b316?src=pr&el=desc) will **increase** coverage by `0.02%`.
> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/18926/graphs/tree.svg?height=150&width=650&token=eZ4WkYLtcO&src=pr)](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/18926?src=pr&el=tree)

```diff
##           master   #18926      +/-   ##
==========================================

==========================================
  Files         150      150              
  Lines       48939    48939              
==========================================
+ Hits        44805    44815      +10     
+ Misses       4134     4124      -10
```

| #single | `41.76% <ø> (ø)` | :arrow_up: |

| [Impacted Files](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/18926?src=pr&el=tree) | Coverage Δ | |
|---|---|---|
| [pandas/util/testing.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/18926/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL3V0aWwvdGVzdGluZy5weQ==) | `84.74% <0%> (-0.22%)` | :arrow_down: |
| [pandas/plotting/\_converter.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/18926/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL3Bsb3R0aW5nL19jb252ZXJ0ZXIucHk=) | `66.95% <0%> (+1.73%)` | :arrow_up: |

------

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/18926?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/18926?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [0e3c797...f7952bd](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/18926?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
can you reduce the add_offset size a bit, so these are in-line to the others?
cc @jbrockmendel as you would expect on these?
I don't see anything obviously problematic, but hard to say much without something to compare against.  And even with, you know my thoughts on asv reliability...
@mroeschke did you push the smaller n? can you show an update?
Currently on vacation, but I will be back on the weekend to update the PR

Reduced the samples for the addition benchmarks by a factor of 10. Additionally changed the current lint rule for asv to capture the files I already cleaned up.
